content: When you select 'none' under autoplay it still autoplays many moves. This is quite frustrating when trying to maximize points. It makes it difficult to apply a patient strategy. Please fix this.
replyContent: If you also uncheck "Play available cards first" in Hint button action, it will never autoplay. There's a "Play for maximum points" autoplay setting for Klondike you can try and see if you prefer.

content: I have tried multiple solitaire games over the years and this one is undeniably the best.
replyContent: Thanks so much for your review! Please let me know if you ever run into any problems with the app or have any questions.

content: Still wish that after winning a game you had option to play the game again or start new game. My only other request is the ability to have "undo last move" as an option when you run out of options instead of having to exit out of message THEN select undo. *Please* consider these. üôèüèΩüôèüèΩ Have had this app since 2013. Lots of games but I only use it for Yukon as it tells you game over too soon in Spider when moves are available. Best is that internet isn't required to play.

I was searching for a solitaire app that included multiple styles of solitaire and smooth gameplay with a nice UI, but without having to watch a crummy ad after every hand! This wonderfully designed app fits the bill and is well worth the price! My only qualm is that unlike some of the other (ad-filled) solitaire apps I've tried in the last week there is no option to ensure a winnable hand is dealt! If this was added it would be absolutely perfect.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Dealing only winnable hands is something I'm looking into.

content: I agree that the latest update feels like you're playing against a stacked deck. I've had this app for years and it was a fun way to kill time. I won often enough to want to keep playing. Now I rarely win. It's not much fun.
replyContent: Thanks for the review, but nothing has changed about how the app deals. It does now look ahead at unplayed cards to tell you sooner if there's no way to win the current hand, but you can turn off "Scan stock and waste" in Settings for the old behavior.

content: High scores are bugged out. Sometimes when I close the game and open it next time, all the kings are on foundations and it completes a game for me with no time, a score of 205 and today's date and makes this the new highest score. Still a better app than most money grubbing ad ridden subscription model solitaire apps!
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Could you send me an email with some more details? It doesn't sound like any problem I've seen before, but I'd like to track it down and get it fixed.

content: Best solitaire game out there.
replyContent: Thanks very much! Please let me know if you run into any problems or have any questions.

content: I have had this game for at least a couple of years and loved it. This last update though, really makes you feel like your working against a stacked deck. "There are no obvious moves" happens way to frequently and very early in the game. Several times it came up after only flipping the first card. It definitely needs another and better update.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for the feedback. By default the app now looks ahead at unplayed cards to tell you as soon as it sees there's no possibility of winning by playing forward from where you are. You can turn this off though, and go back to the way it worked in previous versions by unchecking "Scan stock and waste" in Settings.

content: I have owned and used this app for many years now. I highly recommend it. It's been a lot of fun and you can make the games more complicated or more simple to play per your preference.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! I hope you try the v2.70 update, as I fixed several little display glitches that make it play better on Android 10 and above.

content: Why cant I put this on my menu
replyContent: Hi, Sandra. Please email me at support@brasskeysoftware.com and I'll be happy to help.

content: The latest update is fantastic! This is a perfect solitaire game now. This is a very mature product and performs flawlessly. I can't say enough about how much I appreciate the attention to detail the developer has applied to this app. I have been playing for years and the game just keeps getting better. Thanks for a great game!

Solitaire Mega Pack used to be the best solitaire app out there, but it disgracefully sold out and the paid version became an ad-machine so I went searching for something new. The most important thing in a solitaire game is auto-move intelligence and Yukon's is pretty good (though a tad aggressive at moving everything it can to the foundations). The graphics are nice (though I wouldn't hate being able to slow card moves down so that I could see them happen). There's reasonable selection of games and lovely cards and backgrounds. Of all the solitaire apps I've been trying, this one's the winner. Well worth purchasing.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! I originally wrote the app (more than 11 years ago now!) to play myself, and I'm happy other people like it, as well. Rest assured, it will never show ads. I'm always looking for ways to improve it, as I am able.

content: Been my favorite solitaire game for years. Have played on a number of different tablets, both Android and Amazon. Only one problem with all of them. You can never be sure of the size of the cards when opening up the game.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for the feedback! There's an update coming soon that fixes a problem I've seen happen occasionally with the card size on devices running Android 10 and above, particularly in landscape mode.

content: Tldr: good app with lots of features. Paid version has several different versions of solitaire built right into it with what is pretty much a dark mode option (which i love). There are also different colors for cards.

Lots of solitaire games to learn; clean interface; no ads. Basically perfect. I got this game originally for free on Amazon appstore, but I bought the Google play version because it's still the best to just play my favorite solitaire games.
replyContent: Thanks, Kristen, for the kind words! Please let me know if you run into any problems or have any questions. I hope to publish a long-overdue update soon.

content: Love the beauty & simplicity of it. So glad I found this one. The developer also gets right back to you with any questions that you have regarding the use or issues you may have with the app. It was something on my own phone and he still got back to me right away. Very professional and very kind. Very highly recommend.
Nice version. No ads. Which means longer battery life. Reasonable price too.

Nice game. Had a game with much more variety. That paid game Solitaire Mega Pack sold out and started putting ads in the paid version. This is the closest thing I could find to match that. Anyone who is unhappy with Solitaire Mega Pack should check this out. You can try the demo version for free? Developer responds.
Terrific. Never fails. Love it. Thank you.
Love it.
Love it has help. Helps you learn more way to win.
same old game needs some better colors
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, Sandra. If you want to email me at support@brasskeysoftware.com, I'd love to hear any suggestions you have. I'm always looking for ways to improve the app.

content: I've given Yokon Gold Solitair 5 stars because I can't give 'em 6 stars.  What an amazing value.  The cost is just right for the best game of Sol available anywhere bar none.  I've installed several other games of Sol but could never find the right one.   I play to win and win as many games as possible.  I got spoiled on a very old version of Sol that I bought for a flip phone.  I could set options to win with it 75% of the time.  I needed that kind of emotional high with my new smart phone but couldn't find it until I discovered Yukon Gold.  With the right settings and playing style I'm able to win 62% of the time -- incredible!   No ads, no fluff, no nonsense, just fun, fun, fun!  This version has everything anyone could want and support is out of this world.
TERRIFIC! all around app. Needs a HIGH SCORE option. Not just a winning percentage.
I never have any problems with this game app and I use it a lot.
All you need in solitaire.
This is the best solitaire app I've found.
replyContent: Thanks, Mark! A long-overdue update was finally just published today! I've put a lot of work into the game over the years, and I still play it daily myself. Please let me know if you ever have any trouble with the app.

content: love it. thanks so much

Great app - no ads or permissions and fast.   BUT...... this app needs 'player levels'. i.e. Easy, Medium or Expert levels as I have yet to win a game and I have been playing various Solitaire apps for some years. Pointless playing if I can never win - I keep thinking that there is a 'bug' in this version that stops me winning!!  I see that this app has not been updated for some time - would it be possible to add some 'Player Levels' so occasionally I and others can win please ?  Then I would give it 5 Stars without any hesitation.   Many Thanks.
The free version is good but it's worth the buy
Have tried others. Find I enjoy this one the most.

Excellent game and excellent service! This is good people and a game I love 
‚ù§Ô∏è!!!!!!
This is the worst I have ever played. How do I get a refund.
replyContent: Hi, Herbert. I'm sorry you don't like the app. Please contact me at support@brasskeysoftware.com and I'll take care of it for you.

content: Excellent customer service!!  The owner was quick to personally  answer my questions the same day. I was using another solitaire app and I would get an automated reply saying they'd  be back to me in 24 hours with an answer. Frustrating waiting for that company's reply. I bought the app to not get ads. Very inexpensive and worth it. I love  that you can choose theme of face cards to original style if prefer and choose background surface colors. I also love using the hints button ( a question mark) to help me. It is helping me be a better player.

Reliable and well-implemented. Had a crash, sent the report, and got a personal response from the developer saying the bug will be fixed in the next version, and gave me a workaround for the meantime.  Update: very happy to see this game is still seeing updates several years on. Thanks again!

Great solitaire games with no special permissions required.  I'm sure many of the other solitaire games are just as easy and fun to play (how different can you really make a solitaire game), but I haven't found any that don't require some kind of special permissions that are used to sell your information to advertisers.
I still love the game but for some reason it has become very slow on android 7.1. When I tap on a card in the stock pile, there is a long hesitation. Would very much like to see this looked into!
replyContent: Hi, Lloyd. Thanks very much for letting me know! I've had another report of an issue with 7.x, as well, and I'm looking into it. If you could, please email me at support@brasskeysoftware.com, so I can get in touch with you if I need more info or come up with a solution.

content: Would be 5 stars if I could add an picture from my gallery to background
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! That feature is on my list of things to look into.

content: Love playing this, especially 40 Thieves!
Great game
The user experience here is awesome

This app doesn't have an option to not deal unwinnable games. For example, randomly dealt, Yukon has a win chance of less than 50% when played perfectly which means you're wasting your time more than half of the time.
replyContent: Hi, Adam. Thanks for the feedback. You're correct, the game shuffles and deals random hands, just as if playing with real cards. I am, however, looking into the option of only dealing winnable games for the future.

content: Bought it for the freecell game, allows too many cards to move,  even if there aren't open spaces for them (if I have one open column and one open free cell,  I should not be able to move a column of 4 cards to that open column). Very disappointing, I wanted to like it.
replyContent: Hi, Sara. For regular FreeCell the # of cards that can be moved at once is normally (1+the # of open cells)x(2 to the power of the # of open tableau columns). If you are playing Relaxed FreeCell it lets cards be moved regardless of the # of open spaces. Please email me at support@brasskeysoftware.com and I'll be happy to discuss it with you.

content: Just about perfect. Gameplay is excellent, the optional hints are useful, and there are plenty of extra options. Love that I can choose the exact color background I want.
Best vegas solitaire I've found
replyContent: Hi, Tawnya. To select a game, tap the Deal button (looks like the Ace of Spades) and pick "Select a game" from the menu, then choose a game type from the list that appears. Email support@brasskeysoftware.com and I'll be happy to help.

content: Well worth the price. Clean interface, pretty background options, and tons of different types of games to choose from.
I was just looking for a Yukon game and came across this. Plenty of modes, clean UI, good options, very well polished, and most importantly, plays very well. Thanks!
I've owned this game for a long time. I still play it frequently. For some reason it won't update this time.
replyContent: Thanks for the review, Eric! Are you still unable to update the app? If so, please email me at support@brasskeysoftware.com, and we'll get it worked out.

content: Would be better with some difficulty levels tho.
replyContent: Hi, Drakov. Thanks for the feedback! I'm always looking for ways to improve the app.

content: The latest upgrade removed the bouncing Hint button,  I sure miss that feature.  Also now when you deal cards the animation noise stops prematurely before the hand is completely dealt, I think it's not supposed to do that, otherwise love the app
replyContent: Hi, Yvonne. Thanks for the feedback! I liked the bouncing button myself, but it proved pretty widely unpopular, so it was removed. The other button animations are still available as an option. The sound problem has been fixed as of v2.63.

content: Woohoo! it's worth the money.

This was my fave game until the latest upgrade.  I've spent hours on hundreds of games.  But now the upgrade plays itself, moving cards automatically with no way to stop it in the Settings menu. Now you don't play a game or use sny kind of strategy. You just mindlessly click the deck and the cards zoom around the table and into the piles. A chimp could play it as well as a human. Not 'play' at all anymore.
replyContent: Hi, Mary Lou. The second option on the Settings screen is Autoplay. You can set it to "None" or "Only play the endgame". Tap the Config button (small gear), pick Settings, and then pick Autoplay. I don't think how it works changed in this update, though, so that behavior is odd. Please email support@brasskeysoftware.com, and we'll figure it out.

content: Love it!

This really is the best solitaire app. I tried a few before this one and it was the only one that had all the features I wanted. The developer is great and responds to feedback. One thing I wasn't so keen on  was the way the menus jiggle around when you open them and the developer listened and updated it.
replyContent: I'm glad you like the app! The bouncy animation is gone from v2.60 on.

content: Buttery smooth on even low end devices. "No ads ‚Ä¢ No special permissions ‚Ä¢ No in-app purchases". Wish more paid apps were like that.
GOOD JOB! Best in store.
How do I revert back? This "bouncy" animation is awful!
replyContent: Sorry, Deb! The bouncy animation is gone from v2.60 on. Please send us an email (support@brasskeysoftware.com), if you ever have any questions or suggestions. We're always looking for ways to improve the app.

content: Great App!  Excellent fun, with lots of games to choose from.  I have been using the app for about two years on multiple phones and tablets and always find it smooth and responsive.    I found one small issue with the software and received an IMMEDIATE response from the support team who quickly addressed the issue.

I used to enjoy planning this game and was playing towards a goal of reaching $1M. At around the $453,000 mark, the app auto updated, and now I rarely win.  Obviously no longer random. Seems like the update version is biased towards dealing unbeatable games. No longer fun since it has now been programmed to be unfair.
replyContent: Honest, nothing has changed about dealing. I randomly shuffle the deck before each hand (except in FreeCell, which has its own shuffling rules). Sometimes you just have losing streaks.

content: Great simple game but I hardly win it seems.  This seems like one of the best Solitaire games out there too.

Great graphics, response, and all around game play. BUT....I have played 30 games in a row and have only won twice!  Have played solitaire for years and am pretty good at it....I have never had this much difficulty winning. I enjoy a challenge but this game can be somewhat discouraging.
This game is very fun to play but it shure would be more fun if I could win atleat 1 hand. I have played 32 hands strait and still havent won one yet.
I can play for hours.

Oh if only all app developers had this kind of judgement.  First off, the app itself is correctly implemented, with bugs rare to non-existent, and lots of good Solitaire games available with a pleasant and easy-to-use interface that makes playing fast and fun.  Then, every sensible option you could ever desire is available and only 1 or 2 clicks away.  Finally, there is a nice selection of color, card and table choices that make it easy to change the games' appearance to any reasonable whim.
Developer did a good job with this game.

I  would rate it 5 stars,  but there is one thing that continues to annoy me.  So very often when you turn a card over,  the same card of a different suite is under it (on the board not drawing deck) .   Happens way to often to be completely random.  I play one card at a time
replyContent: Hi, Gary, thanks for the feedback! I promise the app does randomly shuffle before each deal. The chances of turning over say a 3 and then another 3 are actually pretty high. After all, there are only 52 cards, and 4 of them are 3s. The same with the other 12 card ranks, so it's likely to happen often. You will find the same effect with real cards.

content: Must have been a phone glitch before. This is the only solitaire I use. Love the card move animations!
replyContent: Glad to hear it! Please let me know if you run into any other problems.

content: I love the new update ! This game is even more alsome now love the new card movement also
Great game, my favorite solitaire game, however just updated and I hate the new sounds for the game.
replyContent: Hi, Steve, The newest update (v2.54) includes an option to turn off the sliding sounds.

content: SIMPLY FANTASTIC! Beautiful app with well thought-out features and options. Responsive developer. Easy to play and personalize. Takes a teensy amount of memory. And best of all, absolutely no ads and no special permissions whatsoever. Why can't all apps be this good??? So very worth the small price. A keeper! (On LG G3)
Works great!  Well worth the money. Samsung Android
Finally a Solitaire game with a proper version of Scorpion (the version i'm used to anyway). Great design, simple interface, no clutter,  definitely worth trying, and an instant buy for me. Cheers.
Was not my cup of tea. Never won a game even if I used the hints.  Not understanding why it deals 3 cards at a time.  Made no senses to me.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for trying the app, in any case. It plays several different types of solitaire. The default game is Klondike, often just called "regular solitaire." In that game cards are dealt from the stock pile 3 at a time. If you'd like to try some of the other types of games in the app, tap the Deal button (Ace of Spades), and pick Select a game.

content: This is the best solitaire app. I like the customizations. The game is fun.
Like being able change style
‚Ä¶ just keeps getting better!

My wife's jealous that she can't find a Yukon game this good on iPad.. using on both Nexus 7 jellybean and HTC Inspire running gbread (Sep 2012). Update: Still true,but updates have made it even better. (Jan2014): Nexus 7 and Nexus 4
Love the range of games available. Easy interface and no stability issues.

Update:  very quick response from the developer who sent me a beta version which does not have the problem., Thank you. I am changing my rating to 5!   Why is it so difficult for developers to set the games with random cards? Great app except I'm sick of playing the same games over and over again.  Please could you at least update the app on a regular basis with new sets of cards?
replyContent: Thanks for the update! I'm glad the new version has solved the problem for you.

content: Great app.

Yes, I will happily pay for an app that delivers the goods without taking advantage of me. But while playing Klondike in portrait mode, a whole string of cards don't quite fit on the screen (king through 2). (I've got an HD 7" device.)
replyContent: Hi, thanks very much for the review! I just wanted to let you know there are a couple of ways to change the card spacing in the app's settings. Just tap the Config button (looks like a small gear), pick Settings, and scroll down to Card spacing. A spacing of 33% works pretty well on a 7" device, or you can use the Collapse option with auto spacing.

content: I've tried several other card games but always come back to this one..

Reduced to just what you need, fantastic. My only two suggestions would be to create a sort of favorite game selector (or hide the ones I never play) and also add a short animation for single tap moves, it works so blazingly fast so that I have to look twice if my move worked at all. Keep up the great work!

THANK YOU so much for your response and information, that alone is worth five stars.  I am relieve (not the right word) to know even YOU have a similar win %.  I'll keep playing, and will recommend this app.  By the way - I have NEVER had a problem with the app failing or causing odd problems w/my phone (like locking it up, etc.) or anything - well done!	Hmmmmm...  Is it me??!  I play Spider (the version with two suits) and it is crazy - I might go WEEKS without a win and then, out of the blue, I get a few 'bones' thrown my way and win 3,4, or maybe five games in a row.  After that - impossible.  Not sure why I don't just give up - guess I'm like an old dog just hanging around for a bone.  The graphics are very nice, the display choices/options are good.  Not sure if this is possible to improve but the brightness setting at the lowest seems quite bright (mi
replyContent: Hi, Tanya. Thanks for leaving a review. All of the deals are purely random, I promise! I mostly play Yukon myself, and I win that about 25% of the time overall. The app doesn't change the brightness setting at all, so that must be the phone. Please get in touch if you run into any problems. I'll be happy to help.

content: Game runs well, graphics are attractive, and menus are easy to use. Rule explanations and in-game hints are helpful. And it's just plain fun to play.
Honest advert free quality game.
Fall asleep playing this every night
Visually stunning game with beautiful card faces. Of all the games I've bought, this one is played daily. Regular updates make this a perfect app, well worth the money.
The interface is fine, & easier to get around then most, but its hard to win. I never get the card I'm looking for!
In my opinion a great suite of games has been ruined by the obnoxious new card design. It is now so ugly I am moving to another app.
replyContent: Hi, Richard. I'm sorry the update caused a problem for you. The app still contains all of the same card designs that were always there. Just tap the Config button (looks like a small gear), and pick Settings. Scroll down to the card faces, and pick the one you like.

content: I play this a lot, and I mean a lot, works exactly like it says on the tin, might be the best Klondike I've tried, on any platform that alone makes it worth the price imho :)

Can you believe it? Actually getting a reply from support is almost unheard of, but this product is supported with regular updates and almost every suggestion I made has been incorporated within a few weeks.  The app works exactly as I want.  All previously noted issues (when first rated as 4 stars) have been resolved.  I first rated this 4 stars with a few quirks... those concerns were addressed. I'm a very happy customer and would buy this again...   As noted by others, the app does not try to spy on phone calls and other personal data like most other apps. A SOLID BUY and will consider buying other apps that this vendor puts out.
It has all the bells and whistles I was looking for and then some. Definetly a game worth having. Also has great support people.
Have played solitare my whole life! Love it! No problems

Everybody has their favourite Solitaire and claim they are the best - I've tried quite a few on my HD Xperia Z and none of them where as good as this both functionally and graphically and the developer is making tweaks and improvements from users suggestions at their request just making it better and better, I challenge anyone to improve on this  This IMO is the Best by a country mile

Got the demo first and loved it, so bought the full product.. well worth the dough. Lots of games and works really well. It sometimes says there are no more moves when there are, but that's really no big deal. I recommend it highly. Plus, NO permissions, which was a big plus for me! Get it! Beverly
The best card game ever! Totally recommend!!    Very helpful when help was needed too!!     A +++++++++++
Has evolved nicely, fixing bugs instead of adding annoying crap, keeping the game clean and focused. Something increasingly rare. Totally worth the buy.
Love it !
First application I paid for!

You wont find a better version than this one. I have tried many different ones and this is the one I always come back to. It is about as bug free as you can get, the cards are like real ones and the play and options are like playing with a physical deck. You won't be sorry you bought this if you like Spider.
Bad deal.  Doesn't  anyone  make a regular  solitaire  game
replyContent: The default is the variant called Yukon. "Regular" solitaire as in Windows is called Klondike, and this app also plays it. Tap the Deal button (looks like the Ace of Spades), pick Quick Select, and choose one of the Klondike games from the list. There are many ways to change the way the app looks and works. Tap the Config button, and pick Settings.

content: This is hands down the best solitaire in Google Play. Work superbly on the nexus 7!
My favorite Klondike. Thx for Galaxy S III fix!
Backgrounds are fixed! Thanks!
I had an issue with this new version. Emailed developer and he promptly  acknowledged the issue and gave me a link to re-install the previous version. You just can't ask for better service than that!
My favorite during short breaks.
I love this on my Tablet but I'd like to be able to increase card size on my phone.  Cards are too small on my RAZR MAXX to make them easy to move.  Otherwise I'd give it 5 stars!
Love this simple card game always loads no problem would recommend it !
Love this game and the upgrade takes them all...and no ads!!!  Get this game! Best money you will spend for an app!
Especially love Yukon Gold. Includes many card games and allows extensive modification of visuals.
App now downloaded OK good game well worth the money
Works perfectly. Just what I wanted.
very good
Best implementation I have played. Developer regularly updates.

I bought this game a couple months back. It worked okay. No crashes or anomalies. but I would rate it as average. everything was just too choppy.  this new update is great! everything is super fluid and snappy. excellent job to the developer.
Very smooth now with great response!  Always been good now great!
Great Spider game, good graphics, and the games are solveable. Saves game when you exit.
Great graphics, nicely done.
Best Spider implementation. It puts the rest of spider games to absolute shame!

I am very happy to finally find a Solitare app that works with an Android 3.1 tablet. The graphics are sharp and display full screen. The games worked every time. Buy this program for your tablet - you won't regret it.
